content.rendered:
What is a Psychiatric Technician?

Psychiatric Technicians, also known as Mental Health Technicians, care for individuals who have mental illnesses and developmental disabilities. They help out with daily tasks like taking vitals or facilitating meals.

Where does a Psychiatric Technician work?

  • Mental health facilities
  • Psychiatric hospitals 

How much does a Psychiatric Technician make?

Based on real new grad salaries reported through Handshake, the median annual salary for a Psychiatric Technician is $31,386.

What majors are typically interested in becoming Psychiatric Technicians?

One’s major doesn’t necessarily determine their career, but these are some common majors of those who end up pursuing this career path.

  • Psychology majors
  • Biology majors
  • Health sciences majors
Search Psychiatric Technician job opportunities on Handshake.

Psychiatric Technician skills and competencies:

On top of a relevant degree and formal training, here are some professional skills that can help aspiring Psychiatric Technicians succeed in their work:

  • Keen observational and listening skills
  • Compassion and patience

What are some common questions about Psychiatric Technicians?

Q: How long does it take to be a Psychiatric Technician?

A: Depending on the program you attend, it can take anywhere from half a year to two years.

excerpt.rendered: Learn about the average salary, relevant studies, and common path after college to becoming a Psychiatric Technician.
